Tensors¶

The tensor property holds a tensor for a point or a segment. Each tensor is defined by a Tensor.Tensor. The TensorProperty.TensorProperty holds all the tensors for a point-cloud.

The TensorFactory.TensorFactory builds either a Tensor (Tensor Class) object or a TensorProperty (Tensor Property).

Tensor Class¶

class Tensor.Tensor(covariance_matrix, ref_point, pts_number, **kwargs)[source]¶

Class for representing a segment as a Tensor

Attributes

covariance_matrix The covariance matrix of the pointset, as computed about the reference point.
eigenvalues Eigenvalues of the covariance matrix
eigenvectors Eigenvectors of the covariance matrix
plate_axis If the covariance relates to a plane (a plate), its normal is the plate_axis
points The points that were used to construct the tensor
points_number Number of points used for tensor computation
reference_point The point according to which the tensor was computed
stick_axis If the covariance relates to a stick, its normal is the stick_axis

Methods

distanceFromPoint(point[, tensorType, sign]) Computing the distance of a given point from the surface defined by the tensor object
normal() Return the normal of the tensor at reference point
setValues(*args, **kwargs) Sets values in the tensor object

The covariance matrix of the pointset, as computed about the reference point.

Computing the distance of a given point from the surface defined by the tensor object

Parameters:
  • point (np.ndarray) – A 3D point (ndarray, 1x3)
  • tensorType (str) – The type of tensor to use for the computation (‘stick’, ‘plate’, ‘ball’ or ‘all’)
Returns:

The distance of the point from the object
Return type:

Tensor Factory¶

class TensorFactory.TensorFactory[source]¶

Methods

computeTensorsProperty_givenNeighborhood(points) Compute tensors for a point cloud.
joinTensors(t1, t2) Create a new Tensor by joining two existing ones

tensorGeneral(arrays[, ref_array, weights, …]) Compute a general tensor (not necessarily 3D)
unifyTensors(tensorList) Create a new tensor by joining multiple ones :param tensorList: List of Tensor objects (list/ndarray) :return: A new tensor which is the result of merging the given list of tensors
static computeTensorsProperty_givenNeighborhood(points, neighborhoodProperty=None, neighborsFunc=None, equalWeights=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute tensors for a point cloud.

For each point a tensor is computed, with the point itself the reference point. If the neighborhoodProperty is None, it is computed here, according to the sent function.

Parameters:points – a point cloud (PointSet or sub-object)

Optionals

Parameters:
  • neighborhoodProperty (NeighborhoodProperty) – a property that holds all neighbors for each point (can be empty)
  • neighborsFunc (function) – the function to be used for neighbors search.
  • kwargs – the arguments for the function to be used for neighbors search. These are usually:
  • radius (float) – search radius for neighbors search
  • knn (int) – k nearest neighbors for neighbors search
Returns:

a tensor property with all tensors computed for each point
Return type:

TensorProperty

Usage

Warning

Now works only for PointSet3D neighborhood search.

classmethod joinTensors(t1, t2)[source]¶

Create a new Tensor by joining two existing ones

Parameters:
  • t1 (Tensor) – First TensorSegment object
  • t2 (Tensor) – Second TensorSegment object
Returns:

A new Tensor object which is the result of merging the two given ones
Return type:

Tensor
classmethod tensorFromPoints(points, point_index=-1, keepPoints=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a Tensor from 3D points

Parameters:
  • points – PointSet
  • point_index – around which point index the tensor is computed. If (-1) the tensor is computed around the center of gravity. Default (-1).

Optionals

Parameters:
  • radius – the radius according to which weights are being computed (if not set, then unit weight is used)
  • keepPoints (bool) – indicator whether to keep the points as part of the tensor object
Returns:

Tensor object
Return type:

Tensor
classmethod tensorGeneral(arrays, ref_array=-1, weights=1, min_points=3, keepPoints=True)[source]¶

Compute a general tensor (not necessarily 3D)

Parameters:
  • arrays (np.array) – an nxm arrays (each row array is the set for the tensor)
  • ref_array (np.array) – the array around which the tensor is computed, if (-1) it is computed around the center of gravity

Optionals

Parameters:
  • weights – the weights for the tensor computation. Default 1 for all
  • min_points (int) – minimal number of points that can define a tensor (default: 3)
  • keepPoints (bool) – indicator whether to keep the points as part of the tensor object
Returns:

a tensor
Return type:

Tensor

Note

If there are less than min_point the covariance matrix of the tensor will be defined as the Identity matrix (with the required shape)

classmethod unifyTensors(tensorList)[source]¶

Create a new tensor by joining multiple ones :param tensorList: List of Tensor objects (list/ndarray) :return: A new tensor which is the result of merging the given list of tensors
